title: Grenada - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 5 July 2020, in Gouyave, Saint John, police shot and injured an unarmed man. Upon hearing about this, residents of the area where this happened took to the street to demonstrate. Initially tensions were high and rioters set fires in the streets and threw up blockades, but the situation deescalated and residents were allowed to peacefully demonstrate. [size=no report]

On 27 June 2020, in Saint George's, Saint George, hundreds of people marched in protest to call for justice after a man was assaulted by a family. The man accidentally hit the family's dog with his car, killing it. [size=hundreds]
On 30 March 2020, throughout Grenada a curfew was imposed to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
On 25 March 2020, througout Grenada a limited state of emergency was declared and a curfew was imposed to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.
PWU: Public Workers Union; Labour Group (Grenada)
On 19 November 2019 in Saint George's, Public Workers Union (PWU) members protested the nonpayment of increments for 243 workers at a local college. [size=243]

On 22 November 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, students from different schools in Grenada protested against the lack of classes caused by the strike in which teachers and other workers are participating. [size=no report]
PWU: Public Workers Union; Labour Group (Grenada); Teachers (Grenada)

On 20 November 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, members of public service unions (PWU: Public Workers Union) including teachers staged a protest to demand access to their benefits. [size=no report]

On 2 October 2018, workers from Grenada Central Hospital protested against the statements of the Prime Minister which implies that the health workers are responsible for the problems of the health sector.

On 1 October 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, health workers protested to demand an apology from the Prime Minister over a remark he made about alleged incompetence in this sector. [size=no report]

On 28 September 2018 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, health workers protested to demand an apology from the Prime Minister over a remark he made about alleged incompetence in this sector. [size=no report]
TAWU: Grenada Technical and Allied Workers Union; Labour Group (Grenada)

On 17 September 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, members of the Grenada Technical and Allied Workers Union (TAWU) protested against the management of the Grenada Broadcasting Network (GBN) in the Caribbean Media Company. [size=no report]
On 8 June 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, various environmental NGOs organized a march to raise attention about the importance of preserving the mangroves in Grenada. [size=no report]
Around 27 April 2018 (as reported), in Gouyave, Saint John, health workers, students and teachers organized a march to call attention to the importance of vaccination. [size=no report]
Government of Grenada (2013-); Police Forces of Grenada (2013-); Teachers (Grenada)

Around 26 February 2018 (as reported), in Saint George's, Saint George, a demonstration and march was organized to call attention to the issue of child sexual abuse. It was co-organized by the Ministry of Social development, the Criminal Investigations Department of the police, and schools. [size=no report]

On 4 January 2018, in Saint George's, Saint George, workers of the National Water and Sewage Authority protested about the status of workers' contracts. They were supported by workers from other industries who answered a call to show solidarity. [size=no report]
